channel.title: Quickstarts on Teiid
channel.description: Recent content in Quickstarts on Teiid

item.title: Access Data Service
item.description: Virtualization Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service Open new browser with the copied OData route URL execute example OData queries and see results

item.title: Access Data Service
item.description: Virtualization Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service Pre-Requisites Define a Data Service Access the US States data service Video demonstrating testing the virtualization

item.title: Define a Data Service
item.description: Integration Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service Open Beetle Studio connect to MySQL database create a view joining some of your data test your data publish your data service copy the URL provided for the OData route.

item.title: Define a Data Service
item.description: Virtualization Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service Pre-Requisites Setup Define a Data Service Uses beetle-studio to: Create a connection to the Openshift US-States database service; Create a virtualization using the connection adding filters if required; Publish the virtualization to Openshift. Video creating a new virtualization

item.title: Integration Quickstart
item.description: Integration Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service This “Teiid in the Cloud” quickstart will lead you through integration of a data service

item.title: Setup for Integration Quickstart
item.description: Integration Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service Setup All you need is a Minishift installation which is available for all the major operating systems (Linux, OS X and Windows). The following examples assume that you have Minishift installed and can be called with minishift from the command line. So, minishift is supposed to be available in your search path, i.e. located in a directory contained in your $PATH environment variable (Linux, macOS) or in a directory from your system path (Windows)

item.title: Setup for Teiid Cloud Quickstart
item.description: Virtualization Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service Setup Minishift A Minishift installation which is available for all the major operating systems (Linux, OS X and Windows). Video installing minishift Database Service This provides a data service in Openshift which can be virtualized. The database is populated with basic tables containing USA district, city and state information. Video installing the data service Beetle Studio The beetle-studio services provide the UI, API and repository for generating new virtualization services from existing Openshift services.

item.title: Virtualization Quickstart
item.description: Virtualization Quickstart > Setup > Define a Data Service > Access Data Service This “Teiid in the Cloud” quickstart demonstrates the virtualization of a data service Goal: A database instance exposed as OData. Setup Install minishift Configure minishift with the following services PostgresSQL DB data service Beetle Studio / Teiid Runtime / Wildfly server Define a Data Service Create a connection to the DB data service Create a virtualization of the connection Publish the virtualization Access the Data Service Execute example OData queries and see results
